page.title: 02ST.MARY'S CHURCH,BRABOURNE
page.content: St.Mary's church at Brabourne is a Norman church,and there is much of interest there. The church is built mainly of local flint and is heavily buttressed.It is said that the church was beginning to lean over to one side,hence the buttresses and the south chapel and aisle. A family very much remembered in St.Mary's church,is the Scot family,who have several memorials to their ancestors,the altar being the most obvious example.There are others however,including some brasses on the floor of the chapel,and a heart shrine in the chancel. St.Mary's is very well known for one of it's stained-glass windows which is recorded as being the oldest stained-glass window in Britain in its original position.
